results.title: Grease
results.creator_credit: Frank Thrower, Shell and A H Luff
results.brief_description: All machinery depends on bearings. Ball and roller bearings are made with the utmost care and precision. All this effort is wasted if lubricants in which they run to don’t stand up to their work. This film illustrates how different types of grease are manufactured to meet different needs; additives being put in to adapt greases for special purposes. Tests are carried out during the manufacture of grease to ensure uniformity of quality and reliability of performance.

results.title: Grease
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Allan Carr, Robert Stigwood and Randal Kleiser
results.brief_description: John Travolta cemented his position as the most versatile magnetic screen presence of the decade in this film version of the smash hit Broadway musical of the same name. Recording star Olivia Newton-John made her American film debut as Sandy, Travolta’s naive love interest. The impressive supporting cast reads like a who’s who in this quintessential musical about the fabulous 50s. Grease is not just a nostalgic look at a simpler decade, its an energetic and exciting musical homage to the age of rock’n’roll. Grease is the word! Includes new, retrospective interviews with the creators and cast of the hit musical.

results.title: Gravity, weight & weightlessness
results.brief_description: Defines weight as the measure of the pull of gravity. Shows how space scientists are studying gravity, weight and the effects of free fall and weightlessness, in order to launch satellites into orbit.

results.title: Gravity waves
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explore important work in the search for gravity waves and in design and construction of equipment to measure this subtle force. Includes an interview with Dr. Joseph Weber, a pioneer in gravity wave detection.

results.title: Gravity is my enemy
results.brief_description: A documentary on painter, Mark Hicks, a man essentially without nerve or muscle function below the neck. Examines his skill, his images, his life and others’ perception of him.

results.title: Gravity
results.brief_description: A variety of everyday experiences are used as an introduction to the study of the principles of gravity. Major effects of gravity on our solar system, tides and effect of distance on gravitational pull are demonstrated and explained.

results.title: Gravesend
results.creator_credit: Island Digital Media and Salvatore Stabile
results.brief_description: 22 year old filmmaker Salvatore Stabile’s debut feature owes a lot to Martin Scorsese’s gritty urban drama ‘Mean Streets’. Like that film, ‘Gravesend’ evokes a particular Brooklyn neighbourhood, painting a bleak picture of disenfranchised youth, aggressive masculinity and seething violence amongst the Italian American community. The film’s straight forward plot revolves around four friends whose usually uneventful Saturday night spins out of control when a member of the group accidentally shoots and kills someone. Their attempts to dispose of the body leads them into a bloody chain of events with inevitable tragic consequences. Cast includes Tony Tucci, Michael Parducci, Thomas Brandise and Tom Malloy.

results.title: Grave of the fireflies = Hotaru no Haka
results.creator_credit: Toru Hara, Studio Ghibli and Isao Takahata
results.brief_description: Majestic and tragic story of an adolescent boy and his little sister, made homeless by firebombing in Japan at the end of World War II and abandoned by callous relatives. Seita is a wily teenager, with the weight of the world on his shoulders as he seeks to find refuge and food for himself and Setsuko, his four year old sister who longs for their mother. After a disagreement with a distant aunt who briefly takes the pair in, Seita and Setsuko start living in an old shelter by the river. At first life is partially idyllic without adult presence; but soon the realities of homelessness start to take its toll on their health. This evocative and typically exceptional anime from Studio Ghibli, is a moving work and an extraordinary narrative about the Japanese experience of WW2. Disc 2 offers an array of fascinating support material.

results.title: Grateful Dead: anthem to beauty
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre, Grateful Dead Productions, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Grateful Dead, known for their experimentation and individual approach to music and performance have sustained a career in live performances since the mid 60’s (originating from the San Francisco Bay area). Infamous for their experimentation with music and hallucinogenic drugs, the band are also well known for their loyal fans (known as ‘deadheads’), who have travelled consistently with the band for 30 years. Priceless interviews recounting many humourous and bizarre tales are told in such a ‘matter of fact’ manner, chronicling their journey from experimental “Anthem of the Sun”, to the accessible “American Beauty”. Featuring interviews with core band members; Jerry Garcia, Phil Lesh, Bob Weir, Ron ‘Pigpen’ McKerman, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann, which includes amongst others a rare interview with lyricist Robert Hunte. Other contributors include David Crosby, biographer Dennis McNally, keyboard virtuoso Tom Constanten, producer Steven Barnaco, legendary engineer Dan Healy and Warner Records chief Joe Smith.
